Articles.Content:
Hey something that has plague my game sense my first time playing is every time I reach or get close to mach 1 (when the shock cone happens) my games FPS decreases to the point of game crash. Ive decided there is nothing I can really do about it but remove it. Is it possible to remove the shock cone file and if so where can i find it to remove it

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T05:58:40Z" title="04/28/2015 05:58  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by War Eagle 1**

![NEAR-FastPureFar.jpg](http://alpha.renegrade.net/NEAR/images/NEAR-FastPureFar.jpg)

Here is an example of what I mean by mach effect.

Every time I reach or get near this point my game crashes.

All I want to do is know if I can delete the data file that causes this effect
No data file Ã¢â‚¬â€œ it's not a part, but a graphical effect. Try reducing the Render Quality Level in the graphics settings.

> 
> No data file Ã¢â‚¬â€œ it's not a part, but a graphical effect. Try reducing the Render Quality Level in the graphics settings.

I have...they are as low as they can get. I found something in the FX file called shockDiamond2.dds. Think that's it?

Edit: not that wasn't it.

- - - Updated - - -

Basicly I just want to know how to take out that graphic effect

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T02:26:40Z" title="04/28/2015 02:26  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by War Eagle 1**

Sorry, wrong graphics setting. Try reducing the "Aerodynamic FX quality."

"Shock diamond" sounds like an [effect for one of the engines](https://youtu.be/KeGidtk6t2Y?t=35).

> 
> Sorry, wrong graphics setting. Try reducing the "Aerodynamic FX quality."
> "Shock diamond" sounds like an [effect for one of the engines](https://youtu.be/KeGidtk6t2Y?t=35).

Holy crap that did it

I can finally go Mach 1 without crashing the game 

You are my hero
